ReviewList.Text: Great book.It helped a lot while trying to get through the class. Only downfall was that it didn't come with master physics log in.

As a college student taking first year physics, I have to say that this book set a high standard of mathematical comprehension. The author offers little examples during his explaintion which leaves the reader lost when trying to apply it on his/her own. The expansion itself can be confusing due to unexplained algebraic manipulations. I found my self avoiding the textbook and found online resources to be much more helpful e.g. Khan Academy. I understand that calculus based physics can be rigorous at times, but even the textbook you learn from, the very tool, shouldn't be confusing. As a computer science college student, this is my point of view.

If you rent it, the description specifically says a rental may not come with an online access number for Mastering Physics, which is why I chose to purchase the book instead of renting it. What they didn't tell you was that if you buy it new IT DOES NOT COME WITH MASTERING PHYSICS. I could have saved myself $65 by just renting it for the semester. The descriptions need to tell you when you're buying a "brand new book" that the online access card hasn't been included.
This text is required for the second semester of general physics at the college I'm attending. I was very happy with the first volume, and am looking forward to the second semester with this book.
I found this text to be a good intro to physics with lots of examples. This text is required reading for introductory physics at the university of colorado boulder.
Not the best physics text book, but it was a required text because my professor wrote a review and its published on the back!
So much cheaper than at my school book store!
